alert.note: Alert for Inland Liberty; Long (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF LIBERTY AND LONG COUNTIES... At 445 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Gumbranch, or 9 miles northwest of Fort Stewart, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph and up to penny sized hail. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to plants, trees and crops is possible. Damage to windshields is unlikely. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of Liberty and Long Counties, which includes Willie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
